item.title: Report E-2025030251
item.description:
Report E-2025030251

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 19, 2025, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN3378 was torn in transit and released approximately seven (7) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel swept all loose product using hand tools. All released product and damaged bags were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums which were staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2025030234
item.description:
Report E-2025030234

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 18, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3267 was damaged and released approximately 20-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted areas. The crew performed a tote transfer to one (1) new 330-gallon tote. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025030180
item.description:
Report E-2025030180

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 12, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1760 was forked and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pavement below the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then transferred the product to one (1) new 275-gallon tote for further processing. The damaged tote was broken down and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025030039
item.description:
Report E-2025030039

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: AUGUSTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 2/24/25, at 15:22 hours, personnel in the CSXT Augusta, GA Yard discovered ENGX 200013, a tank car, residue: last contained Ammonium Nitrate, liquid leaking from the bottom outlet valve. The car was isolated and BASF Corporation were notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025022400160). HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a small drip coming from the bottom outlet area. Contractor personnel were not able to stop the leak and therefor drained remaining residue from the tank car. Contractor personnel then washed the tank car to ensure no additional hazardous residue would leak. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative (David White, 973-262-7591).

item.title: Report E-2025030035
item.description:
Report E-2025030035

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-24
  • City: WAYCROSS
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 2-24-25 at 0408 personnel in the CSXT Rice Yard discovered SHPX 455351, a loaded hopper car of Ammonium Nitrate had collided with SHLX 359 a loaded tank car of Molten Sulfur. The result was the first hopper compartment of SHPX 455351 had failed and released product. Marion Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene to remove spilled lading.
